Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant encourages the careers of new researchers by providing travel support for student authors of accepted papers at the Financial Cryptography 2014 conference. The FC conference is prestigious, and the students' work will stand alongside some of the most impactful research in the field. FC's research agenda includes SaTC's Trustworthy Computing System Perspective and Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences Perspective. The nature and inspiration of the field encompasses at its foundations the invention of cryptographic means to support social protocols such as contracts, exchange, and information intimacy.

The effect of the proposed activity is to sustain and expand the vibrancy of Financial Cryptography research, and research of allied fields, by connecting promising young students of the field to the research community. Their presence at the Financial Cryptography conference will establish relationships that will continue for decades, and guide the young researchers' careers.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Financial Cryptography Conference Student Award grant sought to encourage the careers of new researchers in the field of Financial Cryptography by providing financial support for student attendees at the 2014 and 2015 editions of the premier conference in Financial Cryptography: FC14 and FC15.

A total of eleven students were supported, eight for FC14 and three for FC15. The grant was especially interested in authors of papers in the conference, and ten of the eleven students were presenters of papers. The eleventh student presented a poster session. The recipients came from a wide range of universities and colleges, from across the United States. The grants provided priority funding for women in the field, as two of those funded were women. Two US Citizens who were studying abroad, were also funded.


The intellectual merit of these papers is shown both by the prestige of the proceedings that accompanies the conference, as well as the quality of the established reserachers that regularly attend this conference. The works are widely published, both in top journals for library archiving, and freely available on the Internet. The articles give solutions to difficult problems in the protection of monetary and non-monetary assets, that can be incorporated into the next generation of security products.

The broad impacts are both the development of new and needed products, and the human development of the next generation of researchers. These researchers receive training through the conference experience, and also become part of an important community of scholars that pursue ever more fundamental problems in the science of information. The wide diversity of funded students, as well as the the diversity of institutions which these students attend, aid in the conherence and collaboration across all universities and industries, assuring effective use of human capital.
